name: Moralities of Everyday Life
reviews: It has been a great course. He challenged a good part of my ideas, prejudices, opinions, reflections, attitudes, behaviors on morals. I think the knowledge I learned will resonate for life in me and they are concepts that we must reflect all the time. The world urges positive people, good people and people who have a superior consciousness about the others. We need to listen more, respect more, understand others. We all have our reasons for acting and thinking about the way we do it, but the most significant thing would open our mind, question and think more before making transcendental decisions. Thank you, Professor Bloom! Thank you, Yale!

name: Moralities of Everyday Life
reviews: It is the first online course that I do and experience has been very rewarding, the material has been quite uplifting and the structure of the course well achieved. Some of the material is pending to be renovated or revised since, in the case of the readings, several have ceased to be available. The notes section and the working index of each week help a lot. The subtitles also although it is something that is missing in the readings. Thanks a lot.

name: Moralities of Everyday Life
reviews: I loved. Between looking for an answer about which it can be considered morally correct, and the study of the course affirmed my belief that what can be considered morally correct in a society is very relative and may depend on a wide range of factors.

name: Moralities of Everyday Life
reviews: Extremely useful, I learned a lot from the course and also provided me with great references and with an excellent teacher. I have grown the book that complements the course I recommend a lot.

name: Moralities of Everyday Life
reviews: The lectures, readings and charas are sensational. The teacher is also note 10! I really enjoyed the selection of themes and I intend to do other courses at Yale. Congratulations.

name: Moralities of Everyday Life
reviews: Large introductory course, I hope you are updated soon, however it addresses important issues with good examples and situations.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Sensation of anticlymax. I took the course in expectation of having more practical notions about the elaboration of systematic reviews and meta-analyzes. Of course, that the theoretical basis of this course is very good and fundamental, for obvious, but I was feeling of expectation not reached. I expected for the presentation of practical examples. Of course, that a six-week course would not be full for that, but the presentation of articles and techniques in practice would be of great value to consolidate and systematize knowledge. Also the guidance of the directors of video to teachers to gesture was undue, because in some videos I had to watch again because the hands swaying took more attention than the speech. The interviews also added to the course and it seems that it served to show the erudition and networking of the group of teachers. A feather. I hope there is a new more advanced course so that it can further understand the elaboration of systematic and meta-analysis revisions.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: The course is superficial in methodologies. You can have an overview on the subject, but not at the execution level.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: The course is careful and successful when passing important information. I consider it a starting point for those who want to get more information. There are good indications of important websites and tools for researchers from all areas. There are some adjustments that could be made in relation to the questions made in classes with content, because at times the questions precedes the content. Unfortunately I did not write the exact place where this happened. On the other hand, since the course is well organized, such situations did not compromise its quality. It is an introductory course for a complex theme, which can not be fulfilled online, but my assessment is positive. Thanks.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I really liked the course! I learned many important details that will be extremely useful for the implementation of this methodology in my research group. The interviews were very interesting and the format of the course kept my attention all the time. My only criticism is about the Portuguese mistakes in the videos that remained in the written text. I suggest that teachers edit the text and from the corrections, rule the classes. However, regarding the content, they are to be congratulated!

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Very good course, I recommend. Videos are efficient professional and didactic production. Readings are very interesting and efficiently complement learning. He would only point out two weaknesses in the course. First, because it is a course on quantitative analyzes, it should include at least a bit of computer practices. Second, the quizzes left to be desired, for many of them contain ambiguities or logic errors in the formulation.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Excellent course, with a very passionate and responsible platform, making the student committed to studies. I only found the language with a very technical level, I lost myself at some points, because I did not know the systematic review, and then the language made it difficult in some points, as a suggestion I leave, that if possible to make the language clearer and with many theoretical-practical examples To situate students who do not know the systematic review.
reviewers: By Francisco R A S C

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I found the course incredible, the questions and interviews were great in a very dynamic way. I leave a tip to the end of each week there is a summary on the subject, so we can file it on the computer. If you had the option to download the videos too seriously great so the teachers from anywhere could use and indicate the course, or we students could use to review!

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I liked the direct mode that was built and administered the course. I was also admired by the quality of the materials made available by the links within the reading sessions. Another point I found very cool were the interviews, it is good to realize that we often share the same difficulties and that we can solve them with discussions with other groups.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: A great course! With direct explanations that facilitate understanding! Professors very attentive to clarify doubts and with a great knowledge. Always adding more information to each post! I missed only some activity more focused on practice, but nothing that affected the understanding. I certainly recommend the course !! Thanks!
reviewers: By Liliana d l S M

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I am deeply satisfied with the content and quality of the course in question! My congratulations to the profs. Taís Freire, Julicristie Machado, Everton Nunes, Marcus Tolentino and Ivan Zimmermann. Just a note: I missed a practical example of the picot question. It is as a suggestion. Thank you very much! May God bless you !! Prof. Lúcio Ferreira

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: He hoped the course was more practical, beyond that the course turns much to the health area, however other areas could also be covered. Overall the course is good and the way the content is passed is very clear. Congratulations to those involved.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I really enjoyed the course. He helped me a lot, but I missed a bigger focus on the part of "search strategies" in the databases and more information on systematic reviews for pre-clinical studies (in vitro and in vivo).

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: The course is great, very practical and didactic. It helped me a lot to think about all phases of the systematic literature review.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: The course is excellent! Very didactic, with short videos and goals. The interviews with the professionals were very enriching. Congratulations to the organizers for the beautiful initiative.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I found the course great, my gave a huge base that I did not have during the postgraduate process, now I feel safer and able to evaluate a systematic review and a meta-analysis safely

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I am a master's degree from the Federal University of the Triangle Miner - UFTM and among the final products, are a clinical trial and a systematic review, which is already underway. This course has solved several doubts, as well as my knowledge increased as to all the factors that involve this type of work. I finish more calm and confident that I can carry out a good review, based on the teachings that we were made available for these weeks. Thanks for the dedication of all in publicizing knowledge and concern that this is done in an updated and accurate way. A big hug!!!

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Well enlightening course, didactic, simple, short and direct videos in content. I really liked the course! And I suggest other courses about Using Revman, for example, or other tool.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: We really enjoyed the course, mainly with the method adopted: Videos lessons with little duration, interviews and learning tests! Congratulations to teachers for the course!

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: The systematic review and meta-analysis course with clarity and detail all topics that we should keep in mind thinking about performing a systematic review. Because it is relatively short, it is one of the best introductions to the theme by being goal and practical - you can go make a rectory of your ideas and refining along with the accompaniment of the course. Finally, research with experienced researchers in revisions is what makes the course very special and current. Congratulations Unicamp and Coursera for doing a work of so much academic quality! Thank you UFABC for enabling me to take this course. I recommend to all professionals who want a more detailed view of the scientific methodology.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I am a beginner still in the field of systematic review and meta-analysis and this course was very important for solidifying and increasing my knowledge in the area. I liked the objectivity and diversity of themes worked on this course, which opened the perspective of this labor market. The interviews that are part of the program aggregated a lot and was simply enriching to know better the look and motivation of remarkable characters in this field. Congratulations on the initiative to condense a whole world of information in such a practical and objective way! Thanks!

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Excellent course. The course brings good materials and teachers are well didactic, in addition to the interviews that greatly enrich the discussion. As I saw in comments in this section, we do not usually see these contents in graduation, or we see it very superficially and that they would not aggregate much importance to our career. Today I find that studying science is fundamental, and knowing discerning good or bad evidence makes us better professionals / researchers. Congratulations to all the teachers of the course and the whole organizing team.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: The course was of great relevance, many doubts that I possessed were settled through explanatory audios, my congratulations to all who integrate this platform especially the teachers.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: A very high quality course. I am satisfied, mainly because I feel that now I have the tools needed to start an R.S. using time and work, really needed
reviewers: By MARCIA P S N O

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Dear, I would like to thank for the opportunity and shared knowledge. The course was of extreme clarity, addressing the theme in all its aspects. Thank you very much!

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Congratulations to teachers and staff responsible at launching this course. It was extremely fruitful and added enough. Big hug,

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: It was an incredible experience! As a researcher, I had never had contact with the systematic review, both throughout graduation and a master's degree, because there are no qualified teachers to minister this discipline. All I learned was from scratch. As a way to disseminate this knowledge, I have spread the course for my research group and other teachers who, like me, has a lot of interest in learning about it. Also, throughout this course, I had the opportunity to enter as an author in a scope review. Therefore, much of the acquired knowledge helped me a lot to think critically, understand what I was doing along the stages of the elaboration of the article and give suggestions to the other members of the article. By far, this was the best and most complete course I made along the pandemic. Thank you very much, teachers, for having precious time of you and sharing everything you know with us.
reviewers: By Josefa C P d S

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I loved the course. Corresponded to my expectations for what my counselor had already passed on. I would like to say that I was even more excited to perform my rs even more for all the engagement and knowledge I learned in the course. I make it clear that, without it, my walk in the systematic review could be successfully completed, but with all the imaginable difficulty. With this, besides making me fully based on the knowledge I acquired I will, for sure, go up this course, because the good knowledge must always be passed on, as I have done last week and my friend has already begun. And I really hope that I can achieve my goals.
reviewers: By Douglas T S L M

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Hello, I want to congratulate the availability of the course, but especially to congratulate all the teachers who ministered the contents. It was evident the seriousness and excellence regarding the knowledge and scientific rigor. Really for me it was a great opportunity to get to know about the referrals about the production of a systematic review and meta-analysis, mainly because it came to meet, at this point that I am in Master's. I am a student of the UFPR Education Master and learned from the course through my counselor. I hope to have the opportunity to accompany other courses. Thanks! Lurdes.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: This course was extremely important and enriching for my present / future researcher career. Excellent lessons and explanations, good teachers, good and satisfactory knowledge tests that have added much value to the course, not counting the great interviews. I learned a lot that I will take for the rest of my life and I could also heal doubts that I had about this grandiose universe that is the systematic review. Thank you immensely to the teachers and teachers who have taught this content with so hard, thank you! I will recommend to everyone I know.
reviewers: By Juliana I B d S

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Exceptional course! I indicate all colleagues at the Academy, even if they do not have aimed at developing a systematic review at present, we must have knowledge of all its development process, the importance of this type of study for clinical practice, as well as for health management. Therefore, this course, brought me property about this type of revision, all its potentialities, implications, the walk to develop it effectively, in addition to presenting us with interviews from renowned researchers!

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I am a doctorate student of the FMRP-USP was very enlightening the course, I work with Genetics in Cutting Cattle, and to finish my thesis I am elaborating a systematic review with my initial question, where I will join the main results I arrived throughout my experiment . Although we do not have a wide range of surveys in my area as in the epidemiological area the course offers several important guidelines and features great tools to perform a quality job. Congratulations to the elaborators

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I thank the teachers who have transmitted their knowledge through video lessons. It is clearly realized that the course was planned very carefully, with affection, with much involvement. Although I be a health professional and researcher, I have as hobbie the graphic design, sonoplasty and editing images and videos, and I know how laborious is to prepare these types of materials. I emphasize that the content of the course helped me improve the criticality in the research and the desire to do things well made. Congratulations on the course.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: I am very satisfied and grateful for the course. I am in Masters and trying to write a systematic review that I stopped at the beginning of the course. I noticed that some important topics from the beginning of a review were not contemplated in mine. Now the course, I intend to resume the writing of my review, following all the recommendations and trying to contemplate all the points required in a systematic review. Course for my colleagues because it is worth every minute of this course.

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: It is a very explanatory and detailed course on how to elaborate a systematic quality revision. The course addresses all questions regarding this type of revision, from internal team questions to the publication of the article. It also provides many software and guide tips that can aid not only in a systematic review but also in the elaboration of other types of study, giving a general panorama of how to perform scientific research more efficiently.
reviewers: By Milena S A d S

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: Great course! I really enjoyed the didactic employed and the support materials indicated for complementary reading. As a contribution, I leave here the suggestion to include in the certificate the total hours of the course and that, in the explanatory videos of the classes, practical examples are presented to illustrate the concepts covered. My gratitude to every team and very successful votes so they can continue to collaborate with the training of researchers in our country!
reviewers: By Alessandra F M d C

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: The systematic review and meta-analysis course provided me with a rather rich introduction and the first meeting with the meta-analysis approach. The contents were very interesting and teachers quite didactic. From the course I believe I can start planning my project from M.A. I would like to congratulate all the teachers, Coursera team and the Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences of Unicamp. Sign up for the course, learning is guaranteed!

name: Revisão Sistemática e Meta-análise
reviews: This course was formidable. It was possible to verify what exactly is a systematic review and the conditions necessary for its realization. I have learned that it is not a simple activity and that to have validity must follow strict criteria of planning, execution and conclusion. Thank you to all the teachers and course team, as well as the Coursera organizers. Congratulations on providing the opportunity to have access to knowledge. Thanks!!!

Gratefully with this course and everyone who participated in him.

Additionally (and no less important) the course offers valuable day-to-day tips to be successful in learning (and in general life). I recommend for people of all ages and / or interests (students, professionals, etc) . [Eng] Excellent Course! IT Covers Interting Brain Facts and Learning Process Concepts. In Addition (and not less important) IT Gives You Valuable Day-by-Day Tips for Being Succesful in Learning (and Life in General) .i Would Recommend it for People of All Ages And / OR Interests (Students, Professionals, etc) .Thanks to Dr. Barbara Oakley, Dr. Terrence Sejnowski and All The People That Made This Course Possible!

I do not want to investigate if scientifically it was a placebo I help me! THANK YOU

name: Marketing Gerencial
reviews: Marketing is, without a doubt, one of the outstanding activities at this time of pandemic, both entrepreneurs and staff of different organizations that seek to add more value. The possibility of understanding more to the consumer, the market and incorporating useful tools to achieve a better position, is key. I think the marketing of services is played very little. I would have liked to navigate more for this place than by the product, although the bases are similar and both, very useful. The course is very well armed and about general marketing knowledge for non-marketing specialists. Personally, I set out to perform a marketing course during quarantine. I did it, I enjoyed it, I recommend it. The Coursera organization is very good, it is simple, it is accessible, it is as it should be. Now, the contents I think they have not evolved for a long time and continues to study with Kotler's books 2 decade or more ... and that seems to me a little weird, especially an issue as marketing that is constantly evolving. The digital is just touched, being a fundamental tool for the world that is coming, the famous new normality. Having marketing knowledge, it is essential for all professional, entrepreneur and gerenyr of any organization. Thank you very much, I will go for more!

name: Marketing Gerencial

reviews: I have made this course of introduction to computer security in various content since it discovered that, in each of them, there is a subject that does not avoid the others. For example, the subjects of the last week were not seen in the other training. I have done it in Cisco Networking Academy, LACNIC, National Technological University (Argentina), and others. I really liked how the topics were faced as well as the new knowledge acquired. I will not get the certificate since, as is public knowledge, the economic situation of my country does not allow me (the cost of the certificate is equivalent to the fourth part of what I pay for the rental of my department). Even so, it was worth it.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Very good course, 100% recommendable, it really gives you a brushstroke about a conception and understanding of human rights since European vision (I come from Chile, therefore I compels the Inter-American Court of Human Rights), I did not give it all The stars because it is difficult to access all the material when it is only available in French, but still, it is good.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Great introductory course of the European human rights system. Perhaps it would have preferred assignments that would allow a greater interaction with both teachers in order to address doubts and reach a more concrete analysis of matter. Delegates a fairly light burden which makes it bearable and helpful for people looking for a superficial understanding of the subject.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Excellent. But they offer the course as it is also the option of taking it in Spanish and it is not like that. The subtitles of the perfect videos, but the Quiz are all in French and they do not have translation within the course. Mandatory readings do not tend to translation. Beyond an imperfect Google translator.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: The course offers you an overview of the situation of human rights in the world and its protection mechanisms as well as international treaties that recognize them and historical evolution. Very rigorous and of a great legal and doctrinal technical level

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: A very interesting and clarifying course to better understand the history of man's rights, its evolution and the current situation. The course is French but can be followed with a B1-B2 level without problems. The tasks and tests are easy to follow

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Excellent course, very complete, as recommendation would be better if exams have translation into English or Spanish since when translating into conventional translators was lost the idea of the questions and their answers, for the rest, it was fabulous

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: It was a very instructive course, as well conclude everything can be encompassed but if it provides a broad panorama in ma matter. With me the goal was fulfilled, I want to continue nutrition from this exciting matter.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Excellent course which brings an international and transcontinental perspective to the application of human rights. It only leaves something lacking to cover human rights in America and Asia.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: I speak in Spanish and English, my French is very poor. In spite of this, I have tried to follow the course and assimilate as much as I could. Very good course.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: A course that not only teaches concepts but also providing a responsible analysis of the theory, very good.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Very good course, maybe the context is very European but serves to understand the Human Rights Convention

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: It is a perfect course for medium education teachers who seek to improve the quality of the content of their courses.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Human rights are a item that should be at the most important fiction of teaching, not only of the law, but of all university matters that have contact with people: medicine, education, food production, water engineering, sociology, psychology ... In short, it is a huge and barely explored field by those who are engaged in the field of law. An excellent way to approach the European human rights system, a little different from the inter-American system to which I belong, but equal, in the Background. It is a privilege to have been able to attend this intruder course and I hope to be able to continue in this type of update exercises. Many thanks.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Excellent course I learned a lot about the protection of human rights at the international arena

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Excellent way to introduce the field of human rights. On the other hand, listening to the course in French and subtitles, it helped me to enter the legal language in that language.
reviewers: By Francisco C F d l P

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: An excellent course, where I learned basic issues in DDHH, but fundamental to have a solid basis, for my training as a lawyer. No doubt highly recommended course.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Hi, I'm Paola, I'm 20 years old and I'm a law student at the University of Santa in Ancash - Peru. In principle, I want to thank the University of Geneva in a very sincere way for having offered a course of such quality. This course has helped me to delve into the knowledge of human rights and at the same time, in I have been able to prepare two trials on the developed topics: relevance of the generational classification at present and the originities of the African Charter of Human Rights and the villages. Both essays supported in my classroom, satisfactorily. Today, I have concluded the course; However, there has been a great interest in the study of international human rights law and later, specialize in the matter. Finally, I want to reiterate my sincere thanks and I hope you can continue to dictate courses like this. Greetings from Peru.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Introduction Aux Droits de L'Homme, has been an extraordinary course. Excellent exhibitors with which we have learned a lot. The guests left us their wonderful experiences and conclusions. In summary, we are more than satisfied with having been a student of the course, to such a point that wonderful expectations have been planted to continue advancing on the issue of human rights. It would be of extreme learning to continue studies on this particular, as well as receiving the diploma Corresponding to this course.Gramented all those who, in one way or another, led us to know about human rights, especially the Mayan instructors Hertige Randall and Michel Hottelier and Coursera.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: It is a good course, teachers are good communicators. Although I am a lawyer, I also learned issues that are out of the scope in which I usually perform and that they claim with the European and African treatment of human rights. As a suggestion, there is reading material that is redirected to pages that no longer exist or were Modified, so it requires a review. With respect to the Spanish translation, it has deficiencies, because who probably translated has no legal training. In any case, if I did not understand any word it was more productive from listening to me again in French.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: As a journalist and specialist in informative covers in United Nations Forums, I can only thank the great opportunity that has given me the prestigious University of Geneva. I am pleasantly surprised to have finished this course with high qualifications, because it means that the challenges I have imposed During this year of pandemic, I enrich my professional goals. Thank you infinite to the two Mayan Academics Hertige Randall et Michel Hottelier, by guiding students and motivating us to continue acquiring knowledge about our rights as human beings.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: I have done the course without knowledge in French language, however it has not been an impediment to clearly understand the content and perform the course questionnaires. It is a magnificent contribution from the headlines of the University of Geneva, and that particularly in my case as a student of law of last semesters, I have served to deepen the knowledge acquired previously and complement with new content. Thank you very much for making such a good academic material available.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: With an interesting content, well explained and based by high quality teachers with excellent credentials that certify them as experts in the field, since they are also professors from the Faculty of Law of the University of Geneva, they also have edifying interviews with personalities experienced in Human rights, because they are enrolled in international organizations that supervise them. An excellent introductive course.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: It is a fairly complete course with general information on the subject, addressed from the point of view of legislation. The examples used are very successful to understand the complexity of the DDHH universe. I enjoyed and learned a lot of this course, even though I do not have any preparation in law. Assessments are only available in French, so it is difficult to understand the questions for those who do not speak this language.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: A very complete and very well organized course by both teachers. Very interesting interviews and help a lot to make contact with the practice of human rights. Locations of very good recordings, help a lot to get in place and be interested in man's rights. Thank you for sharing your knowledge and approaching the University of Geneva.
reviewers: By LEOPOLDO M T D Z

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: The course makes a fairly complete approach to the central elements of human rights and their justifications. It allows you to acquire a wider dimension of different human rights systems in the world, from its main instruments and mechanisms aimed at guaranteeing respect, protection and promotion of human rights. I recommend it.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: It is a very interesting course. In these weeks of course I have not only learned a lot about human rights, but I have been able to verify how important it is to have knowledge, at least basic, on this subject. Finally, I would like to congratulate the organizers, teachers and experts interviewed by their broad and clear explanations.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Very good course, it really was very useful about filling me with new knowledge and being able to reaffirm the ones who already had. I am very happy and grateful to the opportunity that COUrsus gives to be able to learn more and to be able to specialize in an entertaining and effective way on certain subjects. An excellent platform to grow as a professional.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: I would love to continue participating in the courses offered by this website since it allows a great form of learning from home comfort, studies techniques that are applied are very effective and the quality of information as well as teachers is incredible, which shows a high quality of college education.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Although it handles some data from the rights of man, human rights best known as human rights in my country, information and interviews as well as content served me to refresh the data and compare the inter-American system with the European system and The African system. Thanks for the course.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: The courses of the University of Geneva are very professional. They could put the questions from the exams in English or in Spain so that they are much more accessible since the translators are not exact and those who do not speak French, we find that problem in the exams.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: The course gave me many tools to understand everything that involves historical, socially and national and internationally, human rights, thus understanding its foundations, its sources, its typology, the obligations that these entail, limits and implementation.

name: Introduction aux Droits de l’Homme
reviews: Very enriching, with a very general panorama of the international control mechanisms on human rights. Sembrando seeds of concerns and important points to continue studying and investigating. Very grateful for the learning of this course.

name: Essential Epidemiologic Tools for Public Health Practice
reviews: This course was a good primer for those who have little or no background in epidemiology and public health. In particular, the instructor set the practice of public health in the context of its longstanding history and the tools that were developed by researchers and government officials to collect population and health data, in order to respond to health issues and threats in a way that traditional, individualized clinical practice was. However, the instructor does not necessarily make the learning objectives clear in each week, and often tests on material that was only vaguely mentioned in the lecture videos or was poorly defined. The last week of the course, on mapping health data with GIS tools, is promising, as it introduces the student to powerful data tools and comprehensive health and geographic data available to the public. However, it falls short in that this segment provides only a cursory treatment of these tools, walking through an exercise that does not reflect the practical usage of such aids and therefore fails to provide the opportunity for students to attain rudimentary skills.

name: Essential Epidemiologic Tools for Public Health Practice
reviews: Especially in the last class you lack an update. While I understand that it is an introductory course, I would have liked it to be a little deeper in the topics.

name: Essential Epidemiologic Tools for Public Health Practice
reviews: I loved the course. Great material and classes well explained. But I would like to comment on some difficulties I passed and was not due to lack of study. I realized that some classes and materials available were short of the skills necessary for the activities. The guidelines for the production of the Map in EQFis were not adequate. CSV.File worksheets were not being inserted in the program when they requested the withdrawal of the first line and the necessary columns to simplify the map. I say this, because inside the discussion forums, this debate was very intense. I thank all the attention and the great work done.Cordially, Alexandre Lopes

name: Intercultural Management
reviews: It is an interesting course which gives a very cursory overview. Some of the speakers are not easy to understand and in some scenes there is so much background noise (interview with a Nestlé employee comes to mind) that it is impossible to understand. The subtitles are in .txt format and not of really good quality. It took me ages to put it in a nice Word document format to make it readable. I would gladly have paid extra to get some decent documents to work with. One text document gives the text of the previous week's lecture! There are several typos in the quizzes. This does not give a professional impression. The additional reading list is hardly any help as most of the documents mentioned are behind a paywall, if they can be found at all. I don't understand why it wasn't possible to add links leading to the documents and why ESCP Europe could not provide some of the PDFs directly. Some content was outdated, the videos seem to be from around 2012 and it does show a bit. Speaker of week 4 and 5 was very good - factual, clear, whereas the speakers for the first weeks were a bit tiring. - Too much advertisement for various ESCP programmes. I got some information out of this programme, mainly the last two weeks, but I had expected more.

name: Corrección, estilo y  variaciones de la lengua española
reviews: I thought the course is very impractical, because it is about the study directed towards a particular text and for application purposes, it seems to be the most efficient way to teach these issues. While it is true, it allowed me to meet tools from which I had no knowledge (like the existence of corpus and their handling through the Internet), which seems interesting to know, it is not something that I feel that for the purposes I need will go To use intensively, but I understand that it is a good resource to have eventually. In the case of texts (PDF) I found several errors, especially in the first lessons, which I aimed and sent comments to the course (A) of the course (there was also subsequent lessons but these did not indicate them); I hope they are timely corrected for future generations since it seems ironic that there are texts what to correct in a course of "text correction". Likewise, the way in which the interviews were taken me somewhat entangled on the part of the driver, because the way of formulating his questions was not concrete and felt entangled and monotonous to the point of losing and generating confusion. While it is true, the course is offered by a Spanish university, it seems to me that the thematic and language should be more universal, being that in general there are more Hispanic speakers outside the peninsular region. It really was not what I expected.

Since more than learning qualify accurate phrases, textual appointments, they do not show any knowledge of our part, but to copy from the documents we go down, I would prefer that it was more reflective and analytical, but unfortunately it was not like that. Thanks because I really learned. I hope the evaluations are less by obligation and more by knowledge.

name: Corrección, estilo y  variaciones de la lengua española
reviews: In general, it is a very complete, detailed and easy-to-understand course, with extensive use of sources, resources, examples and fundamentations. However, I believe that although it is a great emphasis on which it is a course on the variations in Spanish, it tends to the excessive use of "Spanish people from Spain" in many of their lessons, without making an indication that it is about themselves of the Country of origin of the course. For those of us native speakers of Latin America, this is very confusing and overwhelming, even more to solve the questionnaires of the same lessons, based on expressions that we have never heard or used before. While the variety of a language is important and necessary, precisely, because it is a "style correction" course, the program should make an effort to use a more neutral Spanish, since many professionals who have taken it, we make corrections of style within our Latin American context. Special mention deserves the interviews that complement the learning resources of the course: they are very valuable records that address the main problems of the evolution of our language and the office of the publisher today.

name: Corrección, estilo y  variaciones de la lengua española
reviews: I am a professional translator and I liked the course for several reasons. There is no talk of generalities, but specific issues are treated, very specific (for example, issues of concordance), which is useful because those are the typical doubts that usually arise in the translation process. The teacher is very thorough, which is appreciated. I also liked the interviews and the one who has interviewed people from different profiles and with points of view, sometimes, to contrary. I have not given him five stars because I think, even if he is told repeatedly that the adequacy of the original translation is not valued, there are moments (point, yes) in which he does in a way, in my opinion, Something risky. For example, there is talk of disappearance of repeated lexical units, but the role that the compensations of the loss of these units are not taken into account through the inclusion of other structures (this time, itself reiterated) in other parts of the text. O Speak about 'boy' elision, when there are examples in which it is clearly seen that the burden of that word is transmitted through other strategies; For example, the use of exclamations or the introduction of words type 'to see if ...!' In this particular issue, I agree with the interviewee (and translator) Ehrenhaus in which no conclusions can be drawn about the quality of a translation by limiting the analysis to lexicographic issues. The same thing about the analysis that is made of the use of 'one' and 'you'. The explanation of the teacher is very clear and I understand why it was changed in the last edition of the guard, but I also understand why 'one' was used at first. The use of 'You' with an arbitrary sense has a higher frequency of use in English than in Spanish and the translation faculties, it used to be recommended by the use of other mechanisms (as some of those listed by Professor Hernanz). It is possible that this has changed, since the influence of English is increasingly felt in Spanish. This, I recommend the 100% course. I have learned a lot and solved some recurrent linguistic doubts.

name: Corrección, estilo y  variaciones de la lengua española
reviews: Very good content and examples. The analysis presented in the notes of the very deep, exhaustive and interesting course. However, the evaluation system did not seem the best, especially in relation to the interviews. Making a questionnaire about the literal content I think it's as if they asked me to recite a prayer about something I do not understand but I do remember. I imagine that it should be the way to make sure the students "yes we see the video", but not that we do learn. Very grateful and satisfied, I learned a lot, despite the evaluations =). Greetings from Colombia.

name: Corrección, estilo y  variaciones de la lengua española
reviews: The course I liked it a lot. Touch several topics related to the Spanish language that are very interesting to analyze. I would have liked that the evaluation form is more varied and does not raise only on multiple choice questionnaires, as well as to apply different skills. Due to my studies as a translator, I found a lot of interesting material to contrast lexical and structural options, as well as tools to make decisions when writing a translation. Thank you.

name: Corrección, estilo y  variaciones de la lengua española
reviews: I think that in general the course is very complete and adequate, however it is also a course that is not for everyone since it requires knowledge of linguistic (and sometimes English) superior to the average, so it is more aimed at People who in their training halán treated with similar themes (journalists, linguists, etc), besides that for Latin American people sometimes they will be a little uphill to contain expressions that we have never heard. In general, the information is very complete and well explained, the interviews are very interesting and perfectly complement what is studied in the course. However, I think it has negative points that highlighting: the excessive dependence on the complementary notes that give the feeling that you bought more a book than a course, that the existence are more focused on the content of those notes and not seen in the videos. I think the biggest negative point is in the weeks 5 and 6 where it seems that you are reading someone's degree thesis since the texts of these two weeks are not coherent in difficulty and language with those of the previous weeks, there are several references In Catalan and English (which would be appreciated their translation into Spanish), the contents are passed to compare the Spanish and Argentine versions of Salinger's work to also add to comparison the Catalan and French versions which I see little relevant to content of the course. In general, the last two weeks deviate much of the subject proposed by the title of the course "Correction, style and variations of the Spanish language" and becomes a detailed analysis of the different translations of "El Guardian between the rye", which While it is interesting, it does not meet the objective initially raised and that if it is covered in the first 4 weeks. It is definitely a course I would recommend but with reservations.

name: Corrección, estilo y  variaciones de la lengua española
reviews: This course is very useful, more if it seeks to focus on correcting and stirring texts, adapting them better according to the context and criteria required. The first few weeks are points that could be useful to anyone even in essays, theses, personal work or others as a collaborator, even for the job of writing for pleasure. However, the last few weeks deal with more specific topics that, I would say, are more of someone's interest you want to focus on the work of correcting texts; For someone who does not interest him much or at least not try to take advantage of that punctual information, it could become a little tedious. Of course, I rescue that it is a great course where many skills, curious data are learned or even of language that were not known, in addition to learning to correct our texts a little. Very useful and good this course.

name: Corrección, estilo y  variaciones de la lengua española
reviews: The course was very good with a lot of details of the spanish language, which one as a speaker does not realize the rules. It helps me a lot to understand many aspects of Language and Scripture itself, since the course provides very detailed information. It seemed to me that the lessons were well organized by topic and all have the same rhythm. However, it seemed to me that the teacher was very focused on a pre-determined reading guide for lessons, I would have liked it to be more spontaneous! :) Without EMABRO I understand that the Timepo is gold and I think that is the biggest reason why the lessons were predetermined scriptures. ;) Overall, Great Course and Excellent Delivery, Notes, Explanations and more!

reviews: Excellent, complete, enriching and very current. I recommend this course to all those who have an interest in these issues as a general culture as well as professionals of the language. Then when I met this course I knew it was what I had to do. I assure you that I learned many new concepts and I reviewed others that we always use in the practice of translation. And to keep in mind: it is a course for which you have to study and analyze the cases together with the videos of each lesson to maximize the resources. The materials shared in each class and the explanations on the part of the teachers have been Wonderful And above all, I want to emphasize that I felt very comfortable with the questionnaires and the way in which the notes of each class contributed all the information. I send you a big hug from Uruguay, Montevideo and I hope to meet you with you on another occasion.Firella

More than a course is a "celestin" that allows us to recognize what is better depending on transliterations, translations of other languages and adaptations of the variations of American and peninsular Spanish, which seeks a better understanding of the great jewels of literature , from the search for perspective of the common citizen and that will allow him to understand what he reads.

A novel, tale, literary text, has a time and a place that recreates, with how to talk about its protagonists. I prefer the versions where the original idollect is respected, given that it provides greater elements to appreciate it, even if there is reiteration of them (personal brand of the guardian protagonist ...), although I agree that if there are no translations for them is It is necessary to look for any in your own language. name: Classical Sociological Theory
reviews: Very good course! The teacher is very clear and friendly and the methodology is quite efficient. I would only suggest that they reviewed the system adopted to formulate the issues - I often feel the feeling that the alternatives considered wrong were not exactly wrong, but they only diverged from what the teacher said in the course (I learned in institutions where I Way to avoid this problem is to explain to yourself because the correct answer is correct and because the wrong ones are wrong). Overall I was very impressed and congratulations all involved in the development of the course!

name: Classical Sociological Theory
reviews:
Though I have been studying sociology for 2 years at the university with a number of outstanding lecturers & teachers, this course was still insightful. The main advantage for me was its structure: to look at the particular sociologist each week, repetitively repeating their core ideas (in videos, readings, and tests). While finishing every part, I had a feeling that always appears before the exam - you know, when the whole subject finally becomes understood, coherent and thought-provoking, in a way that you already start to dream of continuation.

The video materials deserve to be discussed separately. Bart van Heerikhuizen is the lecturer that you are never tired of: he highlights the most important ideas usually represented with beautiful and organic illustrations and shows how to treat sociology and its precursors with respect. There were a lot of moments when his words were really touching, often at the ends of the week series: for example, the way he spoke about the times he was visiting Norbert Elias's lectures.

Exercises are repeated, which is probably the only weak side of the course. Firstly it is possible to answer some of them during watching the video, then some of them are repeated in the week test, and, finally, the final test (87 questions!) consists of the week test questions.

Nevertheless, it was a great time, thanks!

reviews: The course has good content, but it does not have the presence of a facilitator or follow-up. name: Competencias Laborales: Perfiles, Evaluación y Capacitación.
reviews: It is a very good course from which things are learned very necessary for work training in any area that one is dedicated to! For me it has been a pleasure to participate in a new course from Oscar Jerez! This course only has 3 stars because I need to make many suggestions for this course especially! First of all, the peer review is a real molar pain for all because it is really unnecessary that 3 pairs will review a task to be able to give a rating and also too much the delay! Second, such a review of peers a fact that many of the students of the course remain without the certification by the delay!. Third, it would be good to see the issue of the rubrics of assessment of the different tasks evaluated by the pairs, such as in the training of a secretary the minimum approval score is 5/6 which is impossible to obtain if only you get 4 points in general! Fourth, in relation to the previous point, it would be great if they can put concrete examples of how to make a form, since the manual per is useful in the breakdown of the information but not much as an example.

name: Competencias Laborales: Perfiles, Evaluación y Capacitación.
reviews: Good afternoon Respect for the development of the course First thanking them, since personally was a time to divert at some time of this challenging and vulnerable time that we are all living. My suggestions, is that at some point there must be someone visible, to solve in the case, for example, the complaint of the companion who closed her work. On the other hand, the disparate evaluation of partners, although it is a strength to have a holistic look of the process, it becomes difficult to understand how the comment says that the work is excellent and / or a good job and the result of approval It is with the minimum approval. Finally when one accesses the courses of his platform he says he will be dictated by the University of Chile, it is assumed to be the credit of the institution, but then in the certificate exposes "a creditless course authorized by University of Chile and offered to Through Coursera ", I think and I feel that this information should be visible and clearly explained, before inciating the course, so that once ended we do not find this message. Thanks

name: Competencias Laborales: Perfiles, Evaluación y Capacitación.
reviews: The course is good the videos and the reading material is great, the works are dynamic and interesting, the problem that I found is that almost all the tasks are corrected by peers, which although it is to learn as a whole and dynamically, this It makes it very slow in addition the corrections sometimes do not throw a description of the errors or the successes, in my opinion it would be better more balance between questionnaires and tasks to be carried out as a whole.

name: Competencias Laborales: Perfiles, Evaluación y Capacitación.
reviews: It is an excellent course if you already have knowledge or experience working with competencies, since it provides many details that in other courses are not taught. But I would recommend it alone as an intermediate training, not for people who start in the subject, as there are many basic things and common knowledge that are not included, therefore can give you a partial idea of the subject. On the other hand, the evaluation system is horrible, tremendous and unnecessarily bureaucratic, it makes a course that should be fast and light becomes very slow to complete. In addition, the peer evaluation leads to that many times qualify people who did not understand the contents, which takes away all validity, and also, evaluated and evaluators can see their names completely distorting neutrality. In summary, good course but complicated to complete, you have to dedicate much more time than it should be.

name: Competencias Laborales: Perfiles, Evaluación y Capacitación.
reviews: Good course, it allowed me to understand very goodly the concepts and progression of them. It would improve the evaluation system, that is, it would include the expert look in addition to that of the colleagues to have greater feedback about the learning process. Also, it would streamline the evaluation process, I had to wait a long time to get the evaluations and I had finished the course a long time ago.

name: Competencias Laborales: Perfiles, Evaluación y Capacitación.

name: Introduction to Molecular Spectroscopy
reviews: Very low quality of explanations, it is necessary to study in other bibliographic references to overcome the course, is monotonous and boring.

name: Introduction to Molecular Spectroscopy
reviews: I was kind of disappointed.  Before this course I had done about half a year of spectroscopy as part of labs undergraduate chemistry at community college, and we hadn't really done any UV other than mentioning its existence.  I took this course hoping to refresh and improve my spectroscopy skills and learn UV before I transfer to University.  Sadly, I found the course to be extremely cursory at best.  Perhaps I was just looking for too much.  Maybe Manchester will offer a sequel? If so I would enrol and check it out. I also found the course to be rather understaffed in that when I tried asking some questions on the forums it took weeks for even another student to reply, much less an instructor.  In addition there seem to have been several wrong answers on the quizzes, as well as typos such as 106 instead of 10^6.  Although the staff has addressed a number of this issues I am still waiting on a correction or comment on the final quiz.  Since I paid for this course, I would like my grade to reflect what I have externally verified is a correct answer.

name: Introduction to Molecular Spectroscopy
reviews: The course is very illustrative regarding the fundamental concepts of spectroscopic techniques. Laboratory questionnaires are of great help to better understand the applications of the different techniques. The course possesses in questionnaires 1, 3 and 4 some errors indicated by the students that should be corrected for future editions. In general terms, the course is very interesting.
